benchmark_details.name: Vision-Language Sanitization and Refinement (VLSR)
benchmark_details.overview: The VLSR framework illustrates a method for label sanitization and refinement in multi-label manufacturing image datasets, improving dataset quality by addressing label noise and inconsistencies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To improve label quality in industrial datasets by sanitizing labels through a vision-language framework.

data.source: Factorynet dataset, a manufacturing industrial dataset containing noisy labels from human annotations and web-scraped sources.
data.annotation: Labels were generated from both crowdsourced and web-scraped sources.

methodology.calculation: Cosine similarity is used to assess the semantic alignment between image and label embeddings to identify suitable labels.
methodology.interpretation: High cosine similarity values indicate effective matches between images and labels.
methodology.validation: The dataset was validated through comparison of image-label pairs and clustering evaluation.
